result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis F Ortiz Martinez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Luis F Ortiz Martinez not in court, in custody.  Attorney Erica N Young appeared by video for Luis F Ortiz Martinez.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Status Conference held.  Defense received an offer this date but advises there may be missing discovery and requests adjournment.
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Luis F Ortiz Martinez not in court, in custody.  Attorney Erica N Young in court for Luis F Ortiz Martinez.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference.
Defense counsel has received discovery and has not received an offer. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Luis F Ortiz Martinez in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Schwantes appeared by video for Luis F Ortiz Martinez.  Attorney Navjot Singh Hira appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Luis F Ortiz Martinez not in court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/18/2022@1:30p
